Posts.Content: Hi guys - I'm new to this, but I am interested to read all of your comments and to see that you all seem to have the same concerns ğŸ˜³. Having had a lumpectomy 16yrs ago, and then in May 2013 I discovered I had breast cancer in the other side, needing chemo, surgery and radio, I opted for a bi-lateral mastectomy which I had in October 2013. I have almost certainly decided to have the deip reconstruction, of which I have to wait for because of radio, so thinking October 2014, but haven't spoken to anyone who's actually been through it yet. I have been told it's fab ğŸ˜€, a 10hr op with a weeks stay in hospital ... But I have also been advised no big driving for 3 mths - and no long distance (over 2hrs) or long haul flights for 6 mths. Because my job involves driving 2hrs + regularly I am wondering how others have found driving afterwards. I would just be interested to hear from people who have had the deip and how they got on with it please... Recovery, scarring, feeling, nipple tattooing etc. I am quite active, love swimming, kayaking and a bit of sailing and am hoping that I can freely carry on with these water sports soon afterwards with confidence in my new body ğŸ˜‰. Good luck to you all with what you are going through ATM. ğŸ˜Šxxx
